name: Suleiman the Magnificent
what_did:
Suleiman ruled the Ottoman Empire at its strongest.
He made fair laws, supported artists and builders, and led many military victories.
People called him 'the Lawgiver' for his fairness.
why_matters:
Suleiman showed that a powerful ruler could also be wise and just.
He helped shape law, art, and architecture in the Muslim world.
His rule was seen as a golden age of the empire.
